questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft Office 365 subscription.
As an administrator for this subscription, you have been tasked with assigning Microsoft 365 licenses for a department where users need to collaborate with other users and also check their job schedules on a weekly basis. The department does not, however, require office desktop products to complete tasks.
Which of the following is the license that would help you achieve this?

discussion.content: Microsoft 365 F3 = Formerly Microsoft 365 F1 > https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=49030
E1 is correct as user can collaborate online and don't need desktop version. F1 is for frontline support.

Selected Answer: B
For a department that needs to collaborate with other users and check their job schedules on a weekly basis, but does not require office desktop products, the best license option would be Microsoft 365 E1.

Microsoft 365 E1 includes web and mobile versions of Office apps, email, file storage, and sharing, as well as Microsoft Teams for collaboration1. This plan is designed for users who need access to Office apps and services but do not require the full desktop versions.

Correct Answer A
There is no license call Microsoft 365 E1

Para atender às necessidades do departamento, onde os usuários precisam colaborar com outros e verificar agendamentos de trabalho semanalmente, mas não precisam dos produtos de desktop do Office, a opção adequada é:

A. **Office 365 F1**

O Office 365 F1 é projetado para funcionários de "Primeira Linha" que não precisam dos aplicativos de desktop do Office, mas desejam colaborar e acessar ferramentas de comunicação, como o Microsoft Teams e o Outlook. Ele fornece funcionalidades de colaboração e comunicação sem incluir os aplicativos de desktop do Office, o que parece ser o que o departamento precisa.

Portanto, a resposta correta é a opção A.

Selected Answer: B
Office 365 F1 is a subscription-based license that is designed for frontline workers. It does not include all of the features of Microsoft 365 E1, such as Teams and Yammer.
Microsoft 365 E1: This is a subscription-based license that includes web-based Office apps and services, but it does not include the full installed versions of Office applications. Therefore, it may not meet the requirement of needing office desktop products to complete tasks.

There is no plan called Office 365 F1, what exists are Micrsoft 365 F1, F3 etc. Plus Why I don't want to choose Microsoft 365 E1 as well is that Windows version will be included. But I see E1 is the best option here as there is no such plan called Office 365 E1.
A. Office 365 F1 Teams Apps free

comments.content: there is no F3 in the answers so the answer is E1

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
but now is office F3

comments.content: That's incorrect. E1 includes Teams. Answer is B. F1 (which is now F3) includes office apps

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The license that would help achieve this is A. Office 365 F1.

Office 365 F1 includes web-based Office applications for collaboration, email hosting, and communication, which would enable users to collaborate with other users effectively. It also includes access to Microsoft Teams, which can be used for scheduling and checking job schedules on a weekly basis.

Microsoft 365 E1 includes web-based Office applications but does not include any collaboration or communication tools beyond email hosting, which may not be sufficient for effective collaboration in the department.

Office 365 E3 includes the desktop products and advanced capabilities such as audio-conferencing, which the department does not require.

Office 365 E5 includes advanced capabilities such as audio-conferencing and analytics, which may not be necessary for the department's needs.

Selected Answer: C
The license that would help achieve this is C. Office 365 E3.

Office 365 ProPlus includes audio-conferencing capabilities in addition to the desktop products, which the department does not require.

Microsoft 365 E1 includes web-based Office applications but not the desktop products, which are required by the department.

Office 365 E5 includes audio-conferencing and other advanced capabilities that the department does not need.

Office 365 E3 includes the desktop products (such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint) without audio-conferencing capabilities, making it the appropriate license for this situation.

Selected Answer: B
Since the question states that users need to collaborate with each other I assume they are going to need at least the webapps for Word, Excel and so on. This is not included in Office 365 F1 since it's a read only functionality of those apps and thus no collaboration is possible.

Microsoft 365 F3
Formerly Microsoft 365 F1 Empower your frontline workforce with productivity apps and cloud services that allow them to do their best work.
F3 Teams come with Shift Management so answer is A

Selected Answer: A
Microsoft 365 E1 does not exist, Office 365 E1 exists.
The E3 license has more services than it requires.
That is why F1 is the best option

So I'd say A

The answer is B 
Office 365 E1 includes web-based apps like Excel and Outlook integrated with cloud services like OneDrive and Teams that enable productivity from anywhere.

• The latest web-based Office apps and business services. Office desktop apps not included.
• Email, file storage and sharing, meetings, and instant messaging.
• Five layers of security and monitoring help keep your data safe.
• 99.9% financially-backed uptime guarantee.

https://www.microsoft.com/en-ww/microsoft-365/enterprise/office-365-e1?activetab=pivot%3Aoverviewtab&market=af

Both include Teams and Sharepoint and OneDrive etc. for collaboration purposes but excludes the desktop products.

Anyone else find the same or am I mistaken here?

I'm noting these questions seem to mix up M365/O365 a lot and it's getting a bit confusing.

It doesn't help that Microsoft keep doing the same thing I suppose

Answer provided is correct

VM -> IaaS
Application -> PaaS
Exchange online -> SaaS

Virtual machine is always IaaS
Web is PaaS
so you can figure out what should be SaaS

a. Exchange Online integrado com o servidor Skype for Business local
b. Aplicativo personalizado da web e móvel conectado com segurança a um armazenamento de dados local
c. Cargas de trabalho baseadas em servidor em uma máquina virtual conectada a uma rede local

Is VM really Iaas? 
In the link it mentions:
Iaas:
"You control access and secure data, identities, applications,
virtualized operating systems,and any infrastructure controls
available from the cloud service."
So MS doesnt manage VM?

comments.content: No it's NOT! SfB on-premise is still fully supported and released with new Windows Server version (latest is 2022). Nobody anywhere ever said SfB on-prem was EOL.

discussion.content: Like you see Skype for Business which is out-of-date still here. This is an old question. MS Teams has replaced Skype!

Exchange online = SaaS
Web = PaaS
VM = IaaS

questions.question_text:
You need to identify which Microsoft platforms provide hybrid capabilities for migrating from an on-premises deployment.
Which two platforms provide hybrid capabilities for migration? Each correct answer provides a complete solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content: With SfB end of life shouldn't this be Exchange and Teams??

comments.content: No, Microsoft Teams works with Exchange and SharePoint Online. These are cloud hosted apps and not available as on-premise tools.
No because SFB server is not EOL and was never said to have been EOL. It's fully supported with regular updates.

discussion.content:
The two Microsoft platforms that provide hybrid capabilities for migrating from an on-premises deployment are:

C. Microsoft Exchange
D. Microsoft Teams

Both Exchange and Teams offer hybrid configurations that allow organizations to integrate their on-premises deployments with the cloud, enabling gradual migrations and coexistence between on-premises and cloud environments. Therefore, options C and D are the correct choices.

As duas plataformas da Microsoft que oferecem recursos híbridos para migração são:

A. **Microsoft Skype para Empresas**
C. **Microsoft Exchange**

Portanto, as respostas corretas são A e C.

Answer is correct, from MS site:
"Microsoft SaaS services include Microsoft 365
cloud apps, Microsoft Intune, and Microsoft
Dynamics 365. Hybrid cloud scenarios with
Microsoft SaaS combine these services with
on-premises services or applications. For
example, Exchange Online can be integrated
with Skype for Business 2019 that is deployed
on-premises."
A and C are correct answers
The hybrid platform doesn't support a message-based interface...that's why answer is A.
Think it's C and D. SfB is dead

yamer é uma rede social nao depende de um servidor local para funcionar 
exchange e skype sao aplicativos que dependem do servidor pra rodar em uma empresa
